verses.name: Mark 12:38
verses.text: And he said unto them in his doctrine, Beware of the scribes, which love to go in long clothing, and love salutations in the marketplaces,

verses.name: Mark 12:39
verses.text: And the chief seats in the synagogues, and the uppermost rooms at feasts:

verses.name: Mark 12:40
verses.text: Which devour widows’ houses, and for a pretence make long prayers: these shall receive greater damnation.

verses.name: Mark 12:41
verses.text: And Jesus sat over against the treasury, and beheld how the people cast money into the treasury: and many that were rich cast in much.

verses.name: Mark 12:42
verses.text: And there came a certain poor widow, and she threw in two mites, which make a farthing.
